simple.escp.fill

Class TableFillHelper.WrappedBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.fill.TableFillHelper.WrappedBuffer
  • Enclosing class:
    TableFillHelper

    public class TableFillHelper.WrappedBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a helper class used internally by TableFillHelper. This class will handle values that need to be wrapped to the next line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TableFillHelper.WrappedBuffer()
      Create a new instance of WrappedBuffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableFillHelper.WrappedBuffer

        public TableFillHelper.WrappedBuffer()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public java.lang.String add(int index,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Add a new text to a column. If the new text need to be wrapped, this method will return a truncated version of value that fits for current line. It will store the rest part of value to buffer that can be consumed later by calling consume(int). If value fits for this column, it will return the left-aligned version of value.
        Parameters:
        index - the column index, starts from 0 for the left-most column.
        value - the value for the specified column.
        Returns:
        the truncated or the left-aligned value.

      • getBuffer

        public java.lang.String getBuffer(int index)
        Get the content of buffer for a column.
        Parameters:
        index - the column index, starts from 0 for the left-most column.
        Returns:
        content of buffer for column at index.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth(int index)
        Get the width of a column.
        Parameters:
        index - the column index, starts from 0 for the left-most column.
        Returns:
        the width for column at index.

      • consume

        public java.lang.String consume(int index)
        Read and remove the value in the buffer that fits for a line. If buffer is empty, this method will return empty spaces as much as the column's width.
        Parameters:
        index - the column index, starts from 0 for the left-most column.
        Returns:
        the value from buffer that fits for a line.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if this buffer is empty.
        Returns:
        true if buffer is empty.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all column's buffers.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Process all column's buffers and insert them as TextLine to current report.
